meanings.definition: To speak or perform without preparation
meanings.sent1: She extemporizes her speeches during class presentations.
meanings.sent2: The comedian extemporizes jokes during his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent3: He always extemporizes his excuses when he forgets his homework.
meanings.sent4: The street performer extemporizes melodies on his guitar for the passersby.
meanings.sent5: The chef extemporizes new recipes using whatever ingredients are available.

meanings.definition: To improvise or make up on the spot
meanings.sent1: The actor extemporizes his lines when he forgets them on stage.
meanings.sent2: During the game, the coach extemporizes new strategies to surprise the opponents.
meanings.sent3: The student extemporizes a story to explain why he was late to class.
meanings.sent4: The artist extemporizes a painting inspired by the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The musician extemporizes a new song during the live performance.
